body:
As an admin, you can enable single sign-on (SSO) for your organization with Google apps as Security Assertion Markup Language (SAML) identity provider. Using Single sign-on with HackerRank allows companies of any size to leverage their existing corporate directories and authentication systems to authorize employee access to HackerRank for Work. It enables the users to log in with a single ID and password to access a connected system.

Prerequisites

  • You must have a Google admin account for your organization.
  • You must have obtained the ACS URL and Entity ID from the HackerRank Customer Support team.

Steps

  1. Log in to your Google Admin account and click Admin Console.
  2. Click the three-line (or hamburger) menu on the left corner of the displayed page.
  3. Click Apps in the left navigation pane.
  4. Click SAML apps.
  5. Click Add a service/App to your domain.
  6. In the Enable SSO for SAML Application dialog box, click Set My Own Custom App.
  7. In the Google IDP Information window, click Download to download either the Certificate or IDP metadata and then click Next.

     Note: You must send one of these files to the HackerRank Customer Support team. Only, after our Customer Support team uploads this file to our system, the SSO is enabled for your organization.

    Expect a downtime of 2 hours for your SSO to work after you send this file to our Customer Support team.

  8. In the Basic Information for your Custom App window, enter the name of the application (which is HackerRank) and click Next.
    Optionally, you can also enter the description of the application and upload HackerRank logo.
  9. In the Service Provider Details window, enter the ACS URL and Entity ID provided by the HackerRank Customer Support team and then click Next.
  10. In the Attribute Mapping window, click Finish.
  11. Click Save in the SSO Configuration dialog box in Hackerrank.
  12. In the Setting up SSO for HackerRank dialog box, click Ok.
  13. In the displayed page, click the three dots menu and then click ON for everyone.
  14. Click Turn On For Everyone to enable SSO.
title: SSO with Google apps
